column4: i agree with Dr_willis's statment.  using the nvidia.com drive on ubuntu, is a poor choice.  (could, but probably isn't, required though).
yup, that sounds like my suggestion.
did you leave the session open?  you need too, inorder to add "more" to a cd.
there is another option, making a cdrw more like a floppy disk, but i don't know ANYTHING about that!  i know it involves "formatting" the cdrw...
I didn't see any option to leave the session open.
it's no a typical option!  it mean most players can't use the cd until it's closed.
if you closed the session the sao/dap isn't gonna help... just sayin'
sessionatonce/diskatonce - i'm familiar with tac (trackatonce) and dao (diskatonce).
you could copy the cdrw contents to your HD, add the files you want.  clear the cdrw and copy it back, with an open session, if you want to add more files.
fyi, you still can't update files, only add new.
er copy the files from the disc to the hard drive add the additional files and then blank and burn them all on to the disc again-is that what you said?
ha ha ha I wouldn't sell many cd burning programs if that's all they could do! ha ha ha
sell free software or propritary software?
I want to be able to add and remove files from my burned cd or dvd as is possible with say Nero.
best of luck.  i won't see your posts further.  enjoy ubuntu.
